Here is the list of 24 Hill Stations Near Chandigarh For An Exhilarating Vacation 1. Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh - Lavish Victorian Buildings 4.2 /5 View 22+ photos Known For : Monkey Point Toy Train Ride Timber Trail Kasauli, nestled in Himachal Pradesh, is a serene hill station that boasts colonial-era architecture set against the backdrop of the majestic Himalayas. It offers a peaceful retreat from the bustle of city life with its lush green landscapes and pleasant weather.Things to do: Explore the Kasauli Brewery, walk on the Gilbert Trail, visit the Christ Church, and soak in views from Monkey Point.How to reach: Accessible by road from major cities, nearest railway station is in Kalka (25 km away), and nearest airport is in Chandigarh.Duration to reach: About 2 hours by car.Places to stay: Kasauli Resort, Forest Ville Hotel, and the Ross Common. Distance from Chandigarh: 58 km Best Time: March - June; September - November 13 Kasauli Attractions View Packages Read More 2. Shimla, Himachal Pradesh 4.8 /5 View 24+ photos Known For : Jakhu Temple Mall Road, Shimla Rashtrapati Niwas (Viceregal Lodge) Shimla, the capital of Himachal Pradesh, is a picturesque hill station once used as the summer capital of British India. Its colonial architecture, bustling bazaars, and panoramic views make it a top tourist destination in North India.Things to do: Stroll on the Ridge, visit the Jakhoo Temple, explore the colonial architecture at Scandal Point, and shop at Lakkar Bazaar.How to reach: Well-connected by road and rail; the nearest broad-gauge railway station is in Kalka, from where the famous toy train connects to Shimla.Duration to reach: About 3-4 hours by car.Places to stay: The Oberoi Cecil, Radisson Hotel Shimla, and Clarkes Hotel. Distance from Chandigarh: 112 km Best Time: October to June 65 Shimla Attractions View Packages Read More 3. Morni Hills 4.0 /5 Morni Hills, located in Haryana's Panchkula district, is the only hill station in the state and is renowned for its lush greenery, serene lakes, and rich biodiversity. The region offers a tranquil respite from the city hustle, with panoramic views of the Shivalik range.Things to do: Boating in Tikkar Taal Lake, trekking, bird watching, and visiting the Morni Fort.How to reach: Easily accessible by road from Chandigarh and nearby cities.Duration to reach: Around 1 hour by car.Places to stay: Morni Resorts, Mountain Quail Tourist Resort, and The Golden Tusk Resort.Best time: September to March, when the weather is cool and pleasant. Distance from Chandigarh: 27 km Read More 4. Parwanoo, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Timber Trail Cable car Ride Fruit orchards Parwanoo, located in the Solan district of Himachal Pradesh, is a scenic hill station known for its orchards, hilly terrain, and industrial units. With its pleasant climate and picturesque setting, Parwanoo serves as a gateway to many nearby tourist attractions.Things to do: Cable car ride to Timber Trail, visit Kali Mata Temple, explore fruit orchards.How to reach: Well-connected by road with Chandigarh and nearby cities; nearest railway station is Kalka.Duration to reach: Around 40 minutes by car.Places to stay: Timber Trail Resort, Park Inn Resort, and Hotel Windsmoor. Nahan, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 8+ photos Known For : Renuka Lake Suketi Fossil Park Trekking in Nahan Nahan is a picturesque hill town in Himachal Pradesh, known for its serene landscapes, beautiful parks, and a rich historical past. Perched atop the Shivalik Hills, it offers a perfect blend of nature and tradition.Things to do: Visit Renuka Lake, explore Suketi Fossil Park, stroll in Rani Tal Garden.How to reach: Accessible by road from Chandigarh and nearby cities; the nearest major railway station is Ambala.Duration to reach: About 2 to 2.5 hours by car.Places to stay: Grand View Resort, Black Mango Resort, and Sirmour Retreat. Distance from Chandigarh: 85 km Best Time: April to September 21 Nahan Attractions Read More 6. Chail, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Chail wildlife sanctuary Camping Kali Temple, Chail Chail, a tranquil hill station in Himachal Pradesh, boasts the world's highest cricket ground and is surrounded by lush forests and stunning views of the Himalayas. Originally a summer retreat for the Maharaja of Patiala, today it's a haven for those looking to escape the bustle of city life.Things to do: Visit Chail Palace, explore Chail Wildlife Sanctuary, watch a game at Chail Cricket Ground.How to reach: Accessible by road from Chandigarh; the nearest major railway station is Kalka.Duration to reach: Around 3 hours by car.Places to stay: Chail Palace Hotel, Jungle Livinn, and Treehouse Chail Villas. Distance from Chandigarh: 109 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Chail Attractions View Packages Read More 7. Barog, Solan Barog, located in the Solan district of Himachal Pradesh, is a picturesque hill station known for its verdant landscapes and British-era architecture. With the backdrop of the Himalayas and dense pine forests, it provides a serene escape from city life.Things to do: Explore the Barog Tunnel, take in views from the Dagshai Jail Museum, hike around local trails.How to reach: Easily accessible by road and rail; the Barog railway station is on the Kalka-Shimla route.Duration to reach: Roughly 1.5 to 2 hours by car.Places to stay: Barog Heights, The Pinewood - HPTDC, and Paradise Resort.Distance from Chandigarh: About 60 km.Best time: April to June and September to November. Distance from Chandigarh: 57 km Read More 8. Solan, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 49+ photos Known For : Kasauli Nalagarh Fort Kuthar Fort Solan, often referred to as the "Mushroom City of India", is a vibrant town in Himachal Pradesh nestled amidst the majestic Himalayas. It's renowned for its pleasant climate, ancient temples, and the presence of several esteemed educational institutions.Things to do: Visit the Shoolini Mata Temple, explore the Mohan Shakti Heritage Park, shop at the local markets.How to reach: Well-connected by road; also has its own railway station.Duration to reach: Around 2 hours by car.Places to stay: Himanis Premium, Hotel Paragon Palace, and Ritz Pine Drive. Distance from Chandigarh: 65 km Best Time: Throughout the year 17 Solan Attractions Read More 9. Nalagarh, Himachal Pradesh 4.4 /5 View 13+ photos Known For : Nalagarh Fort Ramgarh fort Gobind Sagar Lake Nalagarh, set in the state of Himachal Pradesh, is renowned for its heritage and culture, dominated by the magnificent Nalagarh Fort that offers panoramic views of the Shivalik Hills and Sirsa river. This former princely state presents a fusion of history and natural beauty, making it an ideal getaway.Things to do: Explore Nalagarh Fort, visit Ramgarh Fort, stroll around the Gobind Sagar Lake.How to reach: Easily accessible by road; nearest major railway station is in Chandigarh.Duration to reach: Around 1.5 hours by car.Places to stay: The Fort Nalagarh, Heritage Resort Nalagarh, The Woods Villa Resort. Distance from Chandigarh: 47 km Best Time: October to March 4 Nalagarh Attractions Read More 10. Kufri, Himachal Pradesh 4.0 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Himalayan Nature Park (Kufri Zoo) Skiing in Kufri Mahasu Peak Kufri is a picturesque hill station in Himachal Pradesh, known for its pleasant climate, verdant landscapes, and snow-capped peaks during the winters. It's a haven for trekkers, nature enthusiasts, and those seeking a serene escape from the hustle and bustle.Things to do: Skiing in winters, trek to Mahasu Peak, visit the Kufri Fun World, explore the Himalayan Nature Park.How to reach: Well-connected by road; nearest railway station and airport are in Shimla.Duration to reach: Around 3-4 hours by car.Places to stay: Kufri Pacific Resort, Sterling Kufri, Royal Tulip Shimla, Kufri. Distance from Chandigarh: 126 km Best Time: November to March 12 Kufri Attractions View Packages Read More 11. Naldehra Naldehra, located in Himachal Pradesh, is a tranquil hill station renowned for its scenic beauty and the century-old Naldehra Golf Course. It offers a perfect blend of natural beauty with its dense pine-clad slopes and enchanting meadows.Things to do: Play golf at Naldehra Golf Course, horse riding, visit the Mahunag Temple, enjoy picnics amidst nature.How to reach: Accessible by road; the nearest railway station and airport are in Shimla.Duration to reach: Around 3.5-4.5 hours by car.Places to stay: The Chalets Naldehra, Club Mahindra Mashobra, Hotel Golf Glade.Best time: March to June and September to November. Distance from Chandigarh: 135 km Read More 12. Manali, Himachal Pradesh - India's Honeymoon Capital 4.8 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Solang Valley Hadimba Devi Temple Manali Mall Road Manali, nestled in the Kullu Valley of Himachal Pradesh, is a mesmerizing hill station renowned for its snow-covered peaks, pristine rivers, and vibrant local culture. A favored destination for both adventure seekers and peace enthusiasts, it offers a blend of thrilling experiences amidst serene landscapes.Things to do: Skiing in Solang Valley, trekking in Parvati Valley, paragliding, visiting the Hadimba Temple, exploring the Old Manali village.How to reach: By road via National Highway 21; the nearest airport is Bhuntar Airport, and the nearest broad-gauge railway station is in Chandigarh.Duration to reach: Around 8-9 hours by car.Places to stay: The Manali Inn, Solang Valley Resort, Johnson Lodge & Spa. Distance from Chandigarh: 287 km Best Time: October to June 53 Manali Attractions View Packages Read More 13. Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh - The Holy Residence of the Dalai Lama 4.3 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Dalai Lama Temple St. John in the Wilderness Church Dharamshala Cricket Stadium Dharamsala, set against the backdrop of the majestic Dhauladhar mountains in Himachal Pradesh, is globally recognized as the home of the Tibetan spiritual leader, the Dalai Lama. Its serene monasteries, vibrant Tibetan culture, and picturesque landscapes make it a haven for both spiritual seekers and nature lovers.Things to do: Visit Tsuglagkhang Complex (Dalai Lama's residence), explore Norbulingka Institute, trek to Triund, attend a meditation session at Tushita Meditation Centre.How to reach: By road; the nearest major railway station is Pathankot, and the nearest airport is Gaggal Airport.Duration to reach: Around 5-6 hours by car.Places to stay: Dharamshala - The Sanctuary, Hotel Inclover, Fortune Park Moksha. Distance from Chandigarh: 235 km Best Time: October to June 40 Dharamsala Attractions View Packages Read More 14. Mussoorie, Uttarakhand 4.8 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Mussoorie Mall Road Lal Tibba Kempty Falls Mussoorie, often referred to as the 'Queen of the Hills,' is a picturesque hill station in Uttarakhand offering panoramic views of the Himalayan range. With its colonial charm, bustling Mall Road, and abundant natural beauty, it serves as a perfect getaway for both families and solo travelers.Things to do: Stroll on the Mall Road, visit Kempty Falls, explore Gun Hill by cable car, and walk to the serene Camel's Back Road.How to reach: Accessible by road; the nearest airport is Jolly Grant in Dehradun, and the closest railway station is also in Dehradun.Duration to reach: Around 5-6 hours by car.Places to stay: The Savoy, JW Marriott Walnut Grove Resort, WelcomHotel The Savoy. Distance from Chandigarh: 200 km Best Time: September to June 36 Mussoorie Attractions View Packages Read More 15. Kasol, Himachal Pradesh 4.5 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Manikaran Sahib Nature Park Kasol Tosh Kasol, nestled in the lap of the Parvati Valley in Himachal Pradesh, is a haven for backpackers and offers breathtaking views of the Himalayan peaks. With its vibrant cafes, serene environment, and the gushing Parvati River, it attracts trekkers and peace seekers alike.Things to do: Explore Parvati River, trek to Kheerganga, visit Manikaran Sahib, and indulge in the local cafes.How to reach: Accessible by road; the nearest airport is Bhuntar Airport, and the closest major bus station is in Bhuntar.Duration to reach: Around 7-8 hours by car.Places to stay: The Hosteller Kasol, Alpine Guest House, Nomads Hostel. Distance from Chandigarh: 269 km Best Time: October to June 30 Kasol Attractions View Packages Read More 16. Dehradun, Uttarakhand 4.3 /5 View 34+ photos Known For : Robber's Cave Mindrolling Monastery Tapkeshwar Temple Dehradun, the capital of Uttarakhand, is set amidst the Doon Valley and is flanked by the majestic Himalayas, offering a blend of city life with natural beauty. Known for its scenic surroundings, renowned educational institutions, and a mild climate, it's a favorite among travelers and students alike.Things to do: Visit Robber's Cave, explore Forest Research Institute, spend time at Tapkeshwar Temple, and shop at Paltan Bazaar.How to reach: Well-connected by road, rail, and air; Jolly Grant Airport is the nearest airport.Duration to reach: Around 3-4 hours by car.Places to stay: Lemon Tree Hotel, Hotel Softel Plaza, Ramada Dehradun. Distance from Chandigarh: 170 km Best Time: Throughout the year 38 Dehradun Attractions View Packages Read More 17. Kullu, Himachal Pradesh 4.4 /5 View 23+ photos Known For : Great Himalayan National Park Rafting in Kullu Manali Bijlimahadev temple Kullu, often paired with its twin town Manali, is nestled in the lush valley of Himachal Pradesh, offering mesmerizing views of the Himalayas and a haven for adventure seekers. Revered for its temples and the annual Dussehra festival, Kullu is also the gateway to the scenic valleys of Lahaul and Spiti.Things to do: Participate in the Kullu Dussehra festival, visit the Raghunath Temple, indulge in white-water rafting in the Beas River, and explore the Great Himalayan National Park.How to reach: Well-connected by road; the nearest airport is Bhuntar Airport in Kullu.Duration to reach: Around 7-8 hours by car.Places to stay: Apple Valley Resort, The Himalayan Village, and Hotel Aroma Classic. Distance from Chandigarh: 248 km Best Time: March to June 29 Kullu Attractions View Packages Read More 18. Mandi, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Prashar Lake Trek Bhutnath temple Pandoh Dam Mandi, often referred to as the "Varanasi of the Hills," is a serene town located on the banks of the Beas River in Himachal Pradesh, famous for its ancient temples and rich cultural heritage. Its picturesque setting amidst majestic hills and lush valleys provides a tranquil escape for visitors.Things to do: Explore the Bhutnath Temple, visit the scenic Prashar Lake, and experience the cultural Mandi Shivaratri Fair.How to reach: Accessible via road; nearest airport is Bhuntar Airport near Kullu.Duration to reach: Around 5-6 hours by car.Places to stay: Visco Resorts, Hotel River Bank, and Raj Mahal Palace. Distance from Chandigarh: 182 km Best Time: April to October 18 Mandi Attractions View Packages Read More 19. Khajjiar, Himachal Pradesh 4.6 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Khajjiar lake Homestay Experience in Khajjiar Kalatop Wildlife Sanctuary Khajjiar, often dubbed the "Mini Switzerland of India," is a mesmerizing hill station in Himachal Pradesh, renowned for its lush meadows, dense forests, and picturesque landscapes. Nestled at the foot of the Dhauladhar mountains, this serene destination offers an ideal setting for relaxation and nature exploration.Things to do: Visit the Khajjiar Lake, explore the Golden Devi Temple, and indulge in adventure sports like paragliding and zorbing.How to reach: Accessible via road; the nearest railway station is Pathankot, and the closest airport is Gaggal Airport in Dharamshala.Duration to reach: Around 8-9 hours by car.Places to stay: Hotel Mini Swiss, Deodar Manor, and Khajjiar Resort. Distance from Chandigarh: 322 km Best Time: Throughout the year 14 Khajjiar Attractions View Packages Read More 20. Lansdowne, Uttarakhand 4.6 /5 View 17+ photos Known For : Bhulla Lake Tip N Top Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple Lansdowne, once a British hill station, stands as a tranquil retreat in Uttarakhand, characterized by its colonial charm and dense oak and pine forests. With its unspoiled landscapes and peaceful ambiance, it's an ideal escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.Things to do: Explore Tip-in-Top Point, visit St. John’s Church, enjoy boating in Bhulla Tal.How to reach: Best accessed by road; the nearest railway station is Kotdwar.Duration to reach: Around 6-7 hours by car.Places to stay: Lans Castle, Blue Pine Resort, and Fairydale Resort. Distance from Chandigarh: 308 km Best Time: Throughout the year 14 Lansdowne Attractions View Packages Read More 21. Dalhousie, Himachal Pradesh 4.6 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Panchpula Dainkund Peak Beeji's Park Dalhousie, with its colonial architecture and panoramic mountain views, offers a serene retreat in the Chamba district of Himachal Pradesh. Its myriad pine-clad valleys and misty mountains encapsulate the charm of old-world British India.Things to do: Stroll on the Mall Road, visit Khajjiar (Mini Switzerland), explore Kalatop Wildlife Sanctuary.How to reach: The nearest railway station is Pathankot, from where taxis or buses can be taken.Duration to reach: Around 6-7 hours by car.Places to stay: Grand View Hotel, Hotel Mongas, and Aamod at Dalhousie. Distance from Chandigarh: 312 km Best Time: Throughout the year 29 Dalhousie Attractions View Packages Read More 22. Kanatal, Uttarakhand 4.0 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : New Tehri Dhanaulti Camping Kanatal, a quaint village nestled in the Garhwal Himalayas of Uttarakhand, offers a rejuvenating escape with its verdant forests and mesmerizing views of the snow-clad peaks. It's an untouched gem, far from the hustle-bustle, ensuring a serene and tranquil experience.Things to do: Trekking in the surrounding forests, visit the Surkanda Devi Temple, camp under the stars.How to reach: The nearest railway station is Dehradun, followed by a drive to Kanatal.Duration to reach: Around 6-7 hours by car.Places to stay: The Terraces, Club Mahindra Kanatal, and Kanatal Resorts & Spa. Distance from Chandigarh: 244 km Best Time: Throughout the year 10 Kanatal Attractions Read More 23. Narkanda, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Skiing in Narkanda Hatu Peak Hatu Mata Temple Narkanda, perched at a height in Himachal Pradesh, offers panoramic views of the inner Himalayas and is an ideal retreat for both summer and winter getaways. Renowned for skiing in winters and its beautiful apple orchards, it's a serene alternative to the more bustling hill stations.Things to do: Skiing (in winter), visit Hatu Peak, apple orchard tours.How to reach: Nearest railway station is Shimla, from where one can take a taxi or bus to Narkanda.Duration to reach: Around 5-6 hours by car.Places to stay: The Hatu, Hotel Mahamaya Palace, and Agyaat Vaas. Distance from Chandigarh: 172 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Narkanda Attractions View Packages Read More 24. Shoghi, Himachal Pradesh 4.6 /5 View 7+ photos Known For : Kandaghat Trekking in Shoghi Tara Devi Temple Shoghi, nestled in the lap of Himachal Pradesh, is a tranquil hill station enveloped by rhododendron and oak forests. A less-commercialized cousin of Shimla, Shoghi offers pristine natural beauty and an array of ancient temples.Things to do: Visit Tara Devi temple, bird watching, trekking in the forests.How to reach: The nearest railway station is Shimla. Shoghi is also well connected by road.Duration to reach: Around 3 hours by car.Places to stay: Aamod at Shoghi, Eutopia Resorts, and Oakwood Hamlet. Distance from Chandigarh: 102 km Best Time: March - June; September - November 12 Shoghi Attractions View Packages Read More So which of these hill stations near Chandigarh will you prefer visiting on your next long weekend?
